## SDQ vs BIS-11

Harmony is a powerful tool to carry out comparisons between questionnaire items, such as within the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Barrat Impulsiveness Scale (BIS-11). 

Using Harmony's natural language processing and generative AI models, matching and comparing items between SDQ and BIS-11 is now just a click away. Built to take away the burden of manual harmonisation, 'SDQ vs BIS-11' are no longer arduous in the world of Harmony.

## Compare the items in SDQ and BIS-11

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and BIS-11 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BIS-11 into Harmony</a> - compare BIS-11 with other instruments

 You can select SDQ and BIS-11 from Harmony's vast database or simply drag and drop your own PDFs into Harmony's user-friendly web interface. Harmony uses large language models to compare instruments, displaying a percentage match between each item in the SDQ and BIS-11. This makes comparative analysis not only swift but also highly accurate. Consider 'SDQ vs BIS-11' - Harmony not only helps in comparing items in these instruments but it also supports multi-language comparisons.
